title: Shadow Knight graphics
content:
Extracted for Spleen for use with Vortlev.

Basically the tiles, sprites and picture used in the old Keen engine game Shadow Knights. I've also actually managed to find a way to patch this game using CKPatch.

[url=http://www.freewebs.com/levellord_keen/sngraph.zip]www.freewebs.com/levellor...ngraph.zip[/url]

It has a nice ending screen.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Shadow Knight graphics
content:
Freewebs doesn't allow hotlinking which is why the link seems broken. If you really want to make a direct link using freewebs, you could create a html file which instantly redirects to the file that is supposed to be downloaded.

That's at least what I usually did with freewebs, but why are you even using it? There are a LOT better choices available, like [url=http://www.sitesled.com]www.sitesled.com[/url] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
wget seemed happy to download it for me.

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/community/sngraph.zip]Enjoy[/url].

Nice work. I'm not sure when I'll get stuck into this, though. At the moment I'm adventuring through Slackware Linux (and it's working really well so far), and I may experiment with rehashing Vortlev to be compilable on Linux before putting further development into it. It'll be a cinch to implement SK compatibility when I get there.

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
What exactly is Shadow Knight?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
Shadow Knights is a 16 color game based on the Commander Keen enginge, its sprite structure and level structure are simalar to Keens, and its tile format almost identical.

It is aprt of the 'keen engine' series of games, Keen 1-3, Dangerous Dave II, ShadowKnights, Keen 4-6 and biomenace.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
Who sold it? Can I get my hands on a copy?

And wasn't Monster Bash made w/ the Keen 4-6 engine?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
Monster Bash was made with the "F.A.S.T." engine - I think there was at least one other game that used the engine, but I can't recall what it was right now.

You can probably download Shadow Knights from [url=http://www.bestoldgames.net/eng/old-games/shadow-knights.php]somewhere[/url].

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Pharaoh's Tomb and Arctic Adventure use what Broussard called the F.A.S.T.
engine. A later game, Monster Bash, is also billed as using the F.A.S.T.
engine, but it's not the same engine. The engine is completely different,
but the name was recycled.[hr][/quote]
source: [url=http://rinkworks.com/apogee/s/2.8.2.shtml]Apogee FAQ[/url]Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

content: Hmm, I thought the MB version of the engine was later reused for another game (possibly never completed) but I can't find any references to it so perhaps I'm getting it mixed up with something else.

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
Actually, I played this game today, and I have to say.... Was it the bridge between K1 engine and the K4 engine?

I know that games like Cystal Caves and Secret Agent were made with the K1 engine. And I know games like Biomenace were also made with the Keen engine, but I thought that the K1 engine and the K4 engine were different, but this ShadowKnights engine seems to be my missing link in programming and in graphics. =P~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
All Commander Keen engines are related, different versions of the same thing.
Bio Menace uses the CK engine too, but CC and SA don't, although pretty obviously those two do share the same engine.

I think there's some info on it on 3D Realm's site, in the recent Legacy Interviews I think they're called.
Probably more on Wikipedia too, and I think I read something on a fan site as well.
As you might be able to tell, I really don't feel like looking anything up, I'm in a lazy mood at the moment. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content: Keen Dreams was the bridge between the K1 and K4 engine - judging from the file structure, Shadow Knights uses the Keen1/2/3 engine (these are the only Keen games with a "ctlpanel.xxx" file.)  Although it would seem they've made quite a few changes to the engine...  (shame they got the programmer to do all the graphics though [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] )

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
Well, hmm...

I thought CC and SA were made by the CK1 engine? I thought that's what they said in some Keen article on Apogee's website.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Slackware to the rescue!
content:
